description: Once again, the school holidays have been prolonged. It was determined that the holidays for the ongoing second quarter will continue until Sunday, May 10, 2020. As a result, all types of educational institutions, including public and private, religious and international, for children of all ages, will be shut down across the entire nation until this date.

description: On March, 29th 2021, Benin announced that its national vaccination campaign will start on April 1st. 78 vaccination centers will be open. During the first phase of the campaign, vulnerable people will be vaccinated in priority. Vulnerable people are identified by the government of Benin as: health workers, citizens over 60, individuals with conditions that put them at higher risk (diabetes, asthma, arterial hypertension, sickle-cell anaemia).
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
type_vac_cat: Oxford University and AstraZeneca vaccine (AZD1222; also known as the Jenner Institute/University of Oxford vaccine, ChAdOx1)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_group: Certain populations based on demographic characteristics/epidemiological risk given preference for vaccinations
type_vac_who_pays: Vaccine is free for the individual
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Priority Group 1: Essential medical workers; Priority Group 2: People of a certain age; Priority Group 3: People with certain health conditions

description: On May 12, the Government of Benin announced mandatory COVID-19 testing of all airline passengers arriving in Benin.  Tests will be done at passenger expense; fees are 100,000 CFA (approximately $165/€153), payable in cash only, and airlines may require advance payment as a condition of boarding.  Passengers will be required to self-isolate for at least 48 hours until all results have been confirmed negative, and may be subject to additional testing after 15 days.  Those who test positive for COVID-19 will be subject to government-mandated isolation measures, which may include quarantine in a government-designated hotel at passenger expense.  The Government of Benin said it will hold passengers’ passports until all testing and isolation requirements are met to ensure compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Rapid testing center at main airport for arriving passengers. Benin has set up a COVID-19 testing centre at the main airport in the capital Cotonou to boost early detection and containment of the virus. Arriving passengers are systematically tested in one of the 20 booths using a rapid diagnostic as well as polymerase chain reaction test. The rapid testing shows results after 15 to 20 minutes. Those who test positive from the rapid test receive counselling and later medical attention at home if they are asymptomatic. If they show symptoms they are taken to treatment centres.Those who test negative from the rapid test are allowed to go home but must return 48 hours later for results from the polymerase chain reaction test. Anyone testing positive from this test is taken for treatment, while those having negative results self-quarantine at home and undergo a second testing after 15 days.Benin has in recent weeks embarked on systematic testing of people at risk of COVID-19 such as arriving air travellers, health workers and teachers. As of 25 May, more than 14 000 polymerase chain reaction tests had been carried out in the 83 triage and testing sites across the country, including from the airport.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Under measures announced July 13, commercial air travelers arriving in Benin will be subject to up to three tests at personal expense. At least two of these tests will be taken upon arrival at Cotonou Cadjehoun Airport (COO). Travelers must also complete a health form available at the Ministry of Health's Health Surveillance Centre before departure for Benin. Travelers may also have to relinquish their passports on arrival. Passports will be returned after travelers who test positive complete 15 days of isolation and a follow-up negative COVID-19 test. Travelers who test negative can collect their passports from the Palais des Congres 72 hours after their arrival.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

If negative PCR: traveler can proceed; second PCR test required after 15 days"

description: On March 23, 2020, Benin announces a suspension of public transport in the communes of Cotonou, Abomey-Calavi, Allada, Ouidah, Sèmè-Podji, Porto-Novo, Akpro-Missérété and Adjarra starting from March 30, 2020, 00:00. On May 27, 2020, the Benin government lifted the suspension of public transports (buses and mini-buses) with effect on June 2, 2020. It will be drivers' responsibility to make sure that passengers wear masks and respect social distancing. description: On May 12, the Government of Benin announced mandatory COVID-19 testing of all airline passengers arriving in Benin.  Tests will be done at passenger expense; fees are 100,000 CFA (approximately $165/€153), payable in cash only, and airlines may require advance payment as a condition of boarding.  Passengers will be required to self-isolate for at least 48 hours until all results have been confirmed negative, and may be subject to additional testing after 15 days.  Those who test positive for COVID-19 will be subject to government-mandated isolation measures, which may include quarantine in a government-designated hotel at passenger expense.  The Government of Benin said it will hold passengers’ passports until all testing and isolation requirements are met to ensure compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Travelers subject to 15 days of isolation. Under measures announced July 13, 2020 commercial air travelers arriving in Benin will be subject to three tests at personal expense. description: Ivory Coast is meeting UEMOA on the 28th of April in order to decide new joint policies concerning their capacity to produce pharmaceuticals and to share experience among their scientists and leaders of the medical teams responsible for the response to Coronavirus in the respective countries
